intro: Centaurea longifimbriata, commonly known as the long-fringed centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has linear, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue to pink, with a distinctive fringed appearance at the edge of the petals. Centaurea longifimbriata is often used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
